reviews.text: We were a group of 8 people staying there one night before our cruise. It was simply the best way to start our vacations. Ask for the transportation to the pier, it's cheaper than the cruise line and very reliable. The suites are huge, on two floors, perfect for two couples or a familiy. They offer the breakfast(continental). Becky, our minivan driver was just the nicest bus driver ever! The restaurant just besides the hotel(Bahama Breezes) is excellent but very crowdy, reservation are preferrable. Would come back anytime!
reviews.title: Great pre-cruise stay!

reviews.text: We booked the Cruise package at the Chase Suites Tampa and stayed there for one night (January 17) before our Grandeur of the Seas 5 night cruise. The rate was very reasonable and all of the members in our party were very impressed. The shuttle service picked us up from the airport and took us to the Chase Suites, as well as provided us a 10:00 am ride to the cruise port. Our 1 bedroom was a complete mini-apartment suite with kitchen and den. We walked to the beautiful Bahama Breeze restaurant for dinner, which really gave all of us a pre-caribbean experience. A market was also adjacent to the hotel, where we picked up soft drinks, snacks and water for the next morning. Breakfast was available in the lobby, which included cereal, bagels, pastries, waffles, oatmeal, fruit, etc. When we arrived back in Tampa, shuttle service also took us back to the airport. All of this service was included in our hotel price. We have stayed in many hotels before cruising, and the Chase Suites was certainly our favorite, especially with the shuttle service included for all. I highly recommend this hotel for pre-cruising.
reviews.title: Great Pre-Cruise Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were 2 couples going to Packer-Bucs football game in Tampa in Nov. The hotel was perfect for 2 couples. We had a kitchen, livingroom, and a kingsize bedroom w/bath on the 1st floor. The loft had a king sized bed and bath also. It was very clean, lots more room than a regular hotel room, and service was great. Wonderful breakfast buffet. The hotel shuttle took us to the game and back. We had book 2 nites, get 1 free.
reviews.title: Great place, location and price

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel on the bay to everyone. ALso ate at Bahama Breezes next door, and Whiskey Joes about 1 mile away. Food was good and reasonable at both.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very roomy for larger families. Nice pool, near to airport, contenintal breakfast. Great room rates.
reviews.title: Loved the staff! Great location, comfy beds and rooms with everything needed!

reviews.text: We had an efficiency with complete kitchen. No sofa but 2 arm chairs. all are set up like condos with private entrance, Quiet. Nearest Beach, Clearwater is 1/2 hour away. Malls and shopping within 5 minutes. Comfy desk and office chair. Free wireless. Bahama Breeze is right next door with great food, Carribean ambiance and huge outdoor seating with views of Bay. You don't need to drive because free shuttle with Marilyn the very nice driver is happy to take you anywhere within 5 miles. Tip her. Several nice bars and restaurants within 2 minutes by car. "Complete" breakfast has oatmeal, waffles, yogurt, juice, toast, pastries. Don't expect bacon and eggs. Happy hour 4 nights, beer, wine and light munchies. You are not near any stores, liquor or grocery. Nothing nearby. No elevator to 2nd floor if you have difficulty. Get a ground floor unit. Don't bother with bay view. Kid and business friendly with 2 computers, printer etc..
reviews.title: Clean rooms, friendly staff, Next to Bahama Breeze restaurant!

reviews.text: The positives FAR outweigh the negatives here. Yes, it's a bit worn and dated -- nothing horrid. Our rooms were clean and extremely comfortable. I booked through HOTELS.COM -- two huge bedrooms with their own decent bathrooms, full living room and full kitchen. Just over $100. a night! Standard breakfast and a "happy hour" (beer, wine, chips, dip) included along with parking. All this 10 minutes from Tampa International Airport, 30 minutes from Clearwater Beach. Downtown Tampa, Ybor City, Busch Gardens, USF, U of Tampa, football and baseball stadiums, etc. etc. ridiculously easy to get to from this location. We walked to Bahama Breeze for dinner. Every employee we met, EVERY employee, was kind, courteous, and helpful. My deadbolt jammed... it was fixed immediately! My pizza deliverer went astray...one of the employees found him and pointed him in the right direction. This hospitality sets a tone; the guests we met were equally friendly and engaging. People actually converse at breakfast, at happy hour, at the pool. My cousin and I had a GREAT time during our stay. It's not the Ritz, by any means. But if AMPLE space, convenience, and courteous service are important to you, you will not be disappointed by Chase Suites.
reviews.title: Such a Deal!

reviews.text: Although this hotel is older, I was very pleased with the service received from the staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We purchased the Cruise and snooze package which was well worth the money.
reviews.title: Get what you pay for

reviews.text: We stayed prior to leaving on our cruise. We were picked up promptly from the airport,
reviews.title: Nothing like there photo on their website

reviews.text: We stayed there the first day of a trip to Tampa/Orlando. Our flight arrived very late, and we have a small child. This place is nice and close to the airport, but is far enough away not to be an 'airport hotel'. It was a great choice.
reviews.title: Very nice homey place

reviews.text: The location was great, the Staff was fantastic also. The breakfast was good too. At check in, I even asked if we could check out late the next afternoon. There was no problem with that and no extra charge!!
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: The condo we had (and they really truly are condos) a loft and two king size beds, two bathrooms, kitchen and fireplace. It was clean. You can tell that this is an older place that needs slight updating. The furniture is older, however all the rugs were new, our condo was freshly redone with granite counter tops, and the beds are brand new. This is why it is rated at a 2.5 star. The pool and hot tub were also great. We did take advantage of them.
reviews.title: Dark rooms - great staff

reviews.text: On the way home (night before our redeye out) we stayed at the Doubletree down the street which felt like a big corporate business hotel. I would much rather stay at Chase any day over that Doubletree. It just has a very friendly, homey feel with more room to spread out, free breakfast, free wi-fi in the rooms, and a hot tub (doubletree does not have). We will be back. Great place.
reviews.title: Just What I Needed

reviews.text: Almost forgot to mention, the Bahama Breeze Restaurant is right next door on the water. Great drinks in a tropical atmosphere.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and after the 2nd night I woke up with about 20 bites ALL over my body!! They were small bites, just like a flea bite, and itched like crazy. I'm sure the bites were from bed bugs! I hadn't been outside at all the previous night, so I know they weren't mosquitos or some other outdoor bug. I got them during my night's sleep. They need to replace their mattresses or get some serious extermination going on a regular basis!
reviews.title: Nice, but beware of BED BUGS

reviews.text: We stayed overnight before a cruise in early October. We drove down from Alabama. We had a bay view room with a bedroom loft. We arrived early and was able to check in. The room was clean and a bit outdated. The appliances were old but clean and served their purpose.
reviews.title: Very good for the price

reviews.text: The breakfast was okay, and plentiful. Our shuttle to the port was included in the price and so was parking during the cruise and shuttle from the port. The price was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: If cruising out of Tampa again, we would not hesitate to stay at the Chase Suites.
reviews.title: Great Stay for the Location and Price
Nice Beginning to a Great Week
reviews.text: I stopped in Tampa for a few days to visit friends before heading to Miami for a wedding. This hotel was perfectly situated between the airport, downtown Tampa, and Clearwater Beach and there is also a good bar/restaurant right next door. Having a full suite with a living room, dressing area, and a full kitchen saved me a lot of money and made me feel more like I was home, rather than a tourist. I had a bay view room, which was beautiful even though you can see the highway over the bay. The dock could be quite romantic or relaxing, but there seemed to be a few people fishing off of it every night. The staff was extremely nice and they have a shuttle to a gym if you are inclined to work out while there. The pool and jacuzzi were well kept. The buildings themselves need some minor cosmetic updates. I would definitely stay there again.
